verb.description: Rescue (a wrecked or disabled ship or its cargo) from loss at sea.
examples: an emerald and gold cross was salvaged from the wreck

noun.description: The rescue of a wrecked or disabled ship or its cargo from loss at sea.
examples: a salvage operation was under way

origin: Mid 17th century (as a noun denoting payment for saving a ship or its cargo): from French, from medieval Latin salvagium, from Latin salvare to save. The verb dates from the late 19th century.
